channel.title: Server status says online but client says no?
channel.description:
I have just tried getting my server online. I even created a server status page and it accepted it, saying it's online. But now when I go on the client on another computer it doesn't log me in? I think the problem lies in my portforwarding.
I have a dlink wbr-2310 router. heres the portforward config.
name - RSPS Public port - 43594 Private port - 43594 Protocol - TCP
theres the ip address. Should it be the same as my default gateway? because everytime I put that in it says it conflicts with my lan address and doesn't let me save.

item.title: Server status says online but client says no?
item.dc:creator: @Lanthus20 Lanthus20
item.description:
@Lanthus20 wrote:

yeah

just checked command prompt. It got something try and connect.

Oh god, now I can’t connect on the machine that’s hosting the server :eek:

Read full topic
item.source: Server status says online but client says no?

item.title: Server status says online but client says no?
item.dc:creator: @regesterd regesterd
item.description:
@regesterd wrote:

different computer as in your house? if so, i had the same problem, you dont have to worry about that, its online and the ip should stay ass “yourservername”.no-ip.“whatever…”

=]

item.title: Server status says online but client says no?
item.dc:creator: @Lanthus20 Lanthus20
item.description:
@Lanthus20 wrote:

I have just tried getting my server online. I even created a server status page and it accepted it, saying it’s online. But now when I go on the client on another computer it doesn’t log me in? I think the problem lies in my portforwarding.

I have a dlink wbr-2310 router. heres the portforward config.

name - RSPS
Public port - 43594
Private port - 43594
Protocol - TCP

theres the ip address. Should it be the same as my default gateway? because everytime I put that in it says it conflicts with my lan address and doesn’t let me save.
